title: Marknadskommunikatör
description:
Vill du vara med och fortsätta att befästa vår position som ledande varumärke och tillverkare inom Fritidsfordon i Norden samt en stark bidragsgivare till vår spännande tillväxtresa internationellt? Nu söker vi en Marknadskommunikatör!
  
  

Marknadskommunikatör
  
Vi söker nu dig som har bred kunskap inom kommunikation, digitala media och relaterad projektledning. I den här rollen ligger tyngdpunkten på praktiskt och kreativt arbete: att planera, producera och koordinera innehåll i våra olika kanaler. Du behöver vara nyfiken på digital marknadsföring, trivas med ett högt tempo och ha ett öga för detaljer. Det här är en hands-on, operativ roll där du dagligen bidrar till att lyfta vår marknadsföring på både nordisk och internationell nivå.
  
  

Arbetsuppgifter
  
**Sociala medier:** Ansvar för att skapa engagerande och konverterande innehåll för olika marknader, inklusive innehållsproduktion och textarbete. Stödja konsulter samt säkerställa en hög kvalitet och konsekvent nivå på samtliga konton.
  
* Webb: Uppdatering av kabe.se, löpande redaktionellt arbete i Umbraco med nyheter, kampanjer och produktinformation.


**Annonsering:** Producera annonser i branschmedia och kampanjer i Meta, inklusive uppföljning av statistik och enklare optimering.
  
* Externa samarbeten: Huvudansvar för kontakten med KABEs ambassadörer och externa samarbetspartners. Arbetet omfattar bland annat korrektur av material, utlåning av fordon och produktion av marknadsföringsmaterial.
* Mässor & event: Produktion av tryckta annonser, vykort, vepor och liknande exponering inför mässor, nationella kampanjer och lokala event hos återförsäljare samt koordinera marknadsföring kring dessa.
* Katalog & magasin: Delta i produktion av katalog i form av kontakt med fotograf och copywriter samt ansvara för framtagning av magasin, vilket innefattar kontakt med skribent, arbete med layout samt kontakt med tryckeri.


Om marknadsavdelningen
  
Marknadsavdelningens uppdrag är brett och omväxlande med ansvar för extern kommunikation med fokus på KABE’s varumärke och alla våra kärnvärden. Du bidrar med innehåll till olika kanaler, för olika målgrupper och deltar i allt från utveckling av koncept och tonalitet till hands-on produktion. Du skapar rätt känsla både för print, video och digitalt, stöttar kollegor och värnar tydlighet. Du ser trender och har erfarenhet av att driva sociala medier kanaler, både organiskt innehåll och betalda kampanjer.
  
Du arbetar tätt med en kollega med liknande uppgifter och ni har ett nära samarbete med säljare och ledning. Du tar gärna ansvar och projektleder marknadsföring kring sociala medier, mässor och event.
  
Våra målgrupper är nya såväl som mycket erfarna fritidsfordons-entusiaster i primärt Europa med en växande marknad internationellt. Då vi arbetar via Återförsäljare kommer du även ha en regelbunden kontakt med dessa och bidra till även deras kommunikation och digitala utveckling.
  
  

Vem söker vi?
  
Du är en självgående generalist som gillar att arbeta flexibelt, praktiskt med strategi i åtanke. Du driver kampanjer i sociala medier lika enkelt som du skapar innehåll som sticker ut. Det faller sig naturligt för dig att parera flera projekt samtidigt och du stimuleras av att se ett resultat i arbetet. Vidare är du prestigelös som person och har en vilja att hjälpa andra då du blir en del av ett team. Slutligen är du noggrann och värdesätter att leverera ett arbete med god kvalité.
  
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Några års arbetslivserfarenhet från en liknande roll som Kommunikatör eller likvärdig roll där du skapat, producerat och publicerat innehåll i digitala och analoga kanaler
* Erfarenhet av att driva sociala medier kanaler organiskt samt betalda kampanjer
* Erfarenhet av Meta Buisness Suite, Youtube, LinkedIn, Office 365, Mailchimp, Canva, Adobe Creative Cloud: InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, PremierePro
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av att arbeta i Google Ads, Chat GPT eller liknande AI tjänst


Vad erbjuder vi?
  
Ett omväxlande och innovativt teamarbete i ett framgångsrikt företag med korta beslutsvägar. Vi värnar om en god arbetsmiljö med stimulerande arbetsuppgifter. Hos oss får du både den familjära stämningen och fördelarna med att ingå i en större koncern med kollegor och relationer både i Norden och internationellt.
  
  

För ytterligare information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Peter Blomqvist för frågor som rör tjänsten, på nummer 036-393714 eller
  
HR: Lena Lundholm, för frågor kring rekryteringsprocessen 036-393716.
  
Tjänsten är ett vikariat på heltid fram till juni 2026 med goda chanser till förlängning. Placering är på vårt huvudkontor i Tenhult och vi ser gärna att du kan starta så snart som möjligt.
  
Välkommen att visa ditt intresse genom att skicka in ditt CV. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
  
  

Observera att vi, i samband med rekryteringsarbetet, har tagit ställning till vilka kanaler och marknadsföringsmetoder som används. Vi undanber oss kontakt från mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
  
  

KABE AB är den största och ledande nordiska tillverkaren av husvagnar och husbilar med egen utveckling, design och produktion belägen i Tenhult, 10 km utanför Jönköping. KABE tillverkar och säljer husvagnar och husbilar till den europeiska marknaden genom varumärkena KABE och Affinity. Försäljningen av KABEs produkter sker uteslutande via återförsäljare och KABE har idag över 100 fristående återförsäljare på de bearbetade marknaderna runt om i Europa. KABE har idag c: a500 anställda och majoriteten har Tenhult som sin bas.
  
  

KABE AB ingår i KABE Group och har sedan starten 1957 ständigt utvecklats och är idag en internationell koncern med produktion i Sverige, Storbritannien och Polen och försäljning på 14 marknader i Europa. Totalt omsätter koncernen c: a 3,8 miljarder kronor (2024) och antalet anställda uppgår till drygt 870 personer. KABE Group AB är noterat på OMX Nordiska Börs, Stockholm, Nordiska Listan, Mid Cap.
  
  

**Krav:**  

**Körkort:**  

* B (Personbil)

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Description
  
  

Calabrio is the customer experience intelligence company that empowers organizations to enrich human interactions. The scalability of our cloud platform and our AI-driven analytics tools make it easy for contact centers to uncover customer sentiment and share compelling insights with other parts of the organization. Our solutions are built on an intuitive, web-based architecture that positions and accelerates the contact center as an epicenter for customer insight.
  
  

We are looking for a Senior Accountant - International Accounting and Treasury to join our growing team.
  
  

**What you’ll be doing:**  

Monitor the Group´s cash position daily and weekly and propose necessary actions to fit the Group´s cash needs.
  
Assist with support to FP&A for the weekly cash forecasting.
  
Assist with Treasury projects and system implementations as applicable.
  
Ensure timely and accurate manual payment and filings related to GST, HST, VAT and CIT, together with our Tax team and external partners.
  
Work with our various accounting service providers to ensure the month end is accurate and complete, posting and/ or reviewing entries as needed.
  
Prepare local GAAP-to-US GAAP adjustments and ensure differences are reasonable and appropriately documented.
  
Support with Statutory audits.
  
Prepare and post intercompany transactions, responsible for preparation of intercompany account reconciliations monthly.
  
Assist with identification and resolution of any out of balance intercompany variances as needed.
  
Stay current with US GAAP, IFRS, and international statutory accounting requirements.
  
Prepare ad hoc analytics and work on special projects as needed.
  
Requirements
  
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in accounting, or a related field.
  
Fluent in English and Swedish (both spoken and written).
  
Proven experience (5+ years) in a senior accounting role or equivalent.
  
Background in Audit is highly desirable.
  
Knowledge of US GAAP and IFRS; familiarity with local statutory requirements in jurisdictions such as Sweden, the UK, Germany, Canada or Finland is a plus.
  
Experience with intercompany accounting, multicurrency transactions, and international entities.
  
Experience working with auditors.
  
Advanced expertise with Excel and other Microsoft Office applications, experience with NetSuite is considered an asset.
  
Ability to work in a “hands on” basis in a fast-paced and dynamic private equity environment with changing priorities.
  
Strong problem-solving, attention to detail, accuracy, and process improvement skills.
  
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  
Detail-oriented, with a high level of accuracy and integrity in financial reporting.
  
Benefits
  
  

**Our Power is Our People, driven by Our Core Values:**  

**Relentless Innovation:** Kick status in the quo.
  
  

**Customer Obsessed:** Put the customer first. Always.
  
  

**Results Matter:** Take action that impacts. Every day.
  
  

**Ignited by Our Diversity:** Invite inspiration from everyone.
  
  

What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and inspire creativity. Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). As an Innovator with Purpose, you’ll feel motivated and truly excited to come to work!
  
  

**Awards & Accolades:**  

Calabrio has 300 Global Partners, more than 2.25 million agents, and over 7,000 customers worldwide. We’ve been doing this for more than two decades and have been recognized by leading independent third parties such as Gartner, Forrester, and G2 Crowd as a leader and visionary. Thanks to the hard work and dedication of every Calabrio team member, we have been recognized by the Star Tribune Top Workplaces, Great Place to Work UK, named one of BC’s Top Employers, and recognized as a top 50 fast-growth company by Minneapolis/St Paul Business Journal.
  
  

Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.
company_description: Calabrio has joined forces with some of the best minds and most progressive concepts on enriching human interactions through our customer experience intelligence platform.
ceo_name: Joel Martins, Interim CEO and CTO

title: Senior Solution Sales Executive
description:
- **Devoteam is a leading Google Cloud Partner, empowering businesses to harness the full potential of Google Cloud technologies.**  

  

With 20+ years ofsuccessful Google Cloud implementations and a team of certified experts, we drive digital transformation across various industries. We foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning, providing you with the tools and support you need to excel in your career.


At Devoteam, we champion a revolutionary "New Way of Work" that prioritises flexibility, personal growth, and joint success.

  
**Accelerate Your Career: Senior Solution Sales Executive - Google Cloud**

Are you a seasoned sales professional with a passion for cloud technology and a proven track record of success in the IT consulting space? Devoteam is seeking a highly motivated Senior Solution Sales Executive to join our expanding Google Cloud practice. In this role, you will drive new business acquisition and revenue growth by selling our comprehensive suite of Google Cloud consulting services and solutions, with a focus on professional services.


**What You'll Do:**

* **Develop and execute a strategic sales plan:** Target key accounts, identify opportunities, and build a strong pipeline to achieve ambitious quotas and revenue targets.
* **Become a Trusted Advisor:** Conduct in-depth needs assessments, understand client challenges, and position Devoteam as their go-to partner for Google Cloud solutions.
* **Deliver Winning Presentations:** Craft and deliver compelling sales presentations that showcase the value proposition of our Google Cloud offerings, emphasising our expertise in professional services.
* **Collaborate with Experts:** Work closely with our technical consultants to design and propose tailored solutions that address client requirements, ensuring seamless project delivery.
* **Negotiate and Close Deals:** Secure favorable terms and conditions, maximise revenue and profitability, and build long-term client relationships.
* **Stay Ahead of the Curve:** Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving Google Cloud ecosystem, including new products, services, and market trends, to provide cutting-edge solutions.

  
* **Proven Success:** A demonstrable track record of exceeding sales targets in the IT consulting services industry, with experience selling technology solutions.
* **Cloud Expertise:** Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts, with specific knowledge of the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* **Enterprise Focus:** Experience selling to enterprise clients is highly desirable, with a proven ability to navigate complex sales cycles and build relationships with key decision-makers.
* **Communication & Presentation Excellence:** Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely.
* **Negotiation & Closing Prowess:** Strong negotiation and closing skills, with a proven ability to secure favourable deals.
* **Team Player:** Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment.
* **Education:** Bachelor's degree in business, technology, or a related field.

  
- Devoteam is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We encourage applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences.



	* **Competitive Compensation:** Enjoy a competitive compensation package with an uncapped commission structure, that rewards your hard work and success.
	* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Benefit from comprehensive health insurance, a retirement plan, and generous paid time off.
	* **Growth Opportunities:** Take advantage of excellent opportunities for professional development and career advancement within our growing Google Cloud practice.
	* **Cutting-Edge Technology:** Work with the latest Google Cloud technologies and contribute to impactful projects that transform businesses.
	* **Dynamic Culture:** Be part of a dynamic, supportive, and collaborative team culture that values innovation and personal growth.
	* **Flexible Work Arrangements:** Enjoy flexible work arrangements that allow you to balance your professional and personal life.**To Apply:**

Please submit your resume and cover letter. We are excited to hear from you!

title: Receptionist Scandic Winn
description:
**Nu söker vi receptionist för hösten och vintern 2025/2026 till Scandic Winn.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.



Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.



Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.



Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.



Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en extra vid behov för hösten och vintern även fortsatt för sommaren.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

title: Senior Power Electrnocs Engineer
description:
Senior Power Electrnocs Engineer


Swedium Global Services is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Job Name: Senior Power Electronics Engineer


Location: Onsite


Roles and Responsibilities:


* Board power design (DC/DC converters, power architectures, POL converters, EMI filters)
* Design and evaluation of components, protection circuitry, supervision and control functions
* Schematic design and support of board layout
* Power design verification
* Contribute to the strategic analysis of future design trends
* Act as mentor within the technical area
* Application of simulation models and power budgets
* Production support


**Qualifications:**

  

  

  

* BSc or MSc degree in electrical engineering or equal
* 5+ years of experience from power hardware design
* Skills in schematic drawing and experience from a laboratory environment (instruments, measurements etc.)
* Understanding of firmware and software design e.g. C, Labview and HPVEE
* Fluent in English.

  
Job Overview


* Location : Gothenburg, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Power Electronics, Dc DC Converter, EMI filters, Schematic

title: Electronic Hardware Design Engineer
description:
Electronic Hardware Design Engineer


Swedium Global Services is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Job Name: Electronic Hardware Engineer


Location: Onsite in Sweden


About the role


We are looking for an Electronics Hardware Design Engineer within Electronics & Software group. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with new powertrain control development. You will work as part of a top-performance in-house team with highly skilled people, to create world-class powertrain solutions. Our scope is from hybrid engine control systems to cover fully electric powertrains with functions such as Electrical drive units, inverters, and transmissions.


There are unlimited possibilities for collaborative people who are ready to make the difference. We are re-imagining motion for a brighter future. Exploring how to push our environmental impact towards zero. Designing tomorrow´s powertrain solutions for automotive and beyond.


We’re known for being caring, collaborative people with a global mindset, a passion for innovation and a drive to create excellence. Do you want to join us on our journey?


In this position, you will be the Component Owner for key control units such as ECM or Inverter. You will carry full product responsibility over time, ensuring robust design, industrialization, and lifecycle management.


﻿You will be the main contact between customers and suppliers and drive the product development from concept to production. You will be part of a team consisting of Software Component Owners, Architects and experts within System Safety, Cyber Security & EMC.


**Key responsibilities**


* Lead the hardware design and lifecycle management of electronic control units (ECUs).
* Drive industrialization of automotive electronics from concept to production.
* Ensure compliance with automotive standards and best practices.
* Manage and resolve challenges related to EMC, load handling, and functional in/out pinning of circuit boards.
* Collaborate closely with software engineers and system architects to secure integration and node topology.
* Act as technical expert and main contact point for suppliers and internal stakeholders.


**Skill requirements**


**Your profile**


* Master’s degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering or related field.
* Solid experience in electronics hardware development within the automotive industry.
* Proven track record working with industrialization of automotive ECUs.
* Deep knowledge of communication protocols between nodes, EMC impact, loads, and circuit board pin functionality.
* Strong understanding of software interaction and ECU topology
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to take ownership of technical solutions.

  
Job Overview


* Location : Gothenburg, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Power Electronic, Hardware Design, ECU, DC inverters

title: Regulatory Associate - Pagero
description:
**Regulatory Associate - Pagero**


Are you ready to tackle the complexities of global regulatory compliance and drive innovation in e-invoicing and tax technology? As a member of the Regulatory Affairs team, you can be a part of our journey as the global leader in invoicing compliance.


Pagero has recently joined Thomson Reuters. Together, we are building the world’s largest, open business network. With our cloud-based network, customers can reach any business, anywhere in the world – no matter how many borders their operations may cross. We take care of the technical and regulatory requirements across the entire order-to-cash, purchase-to-pay and freight processes, to give customers data accuracy and security, transparency, and real-time visibility. All this through a single connection.


Global regulatory compliance with e-invoicing and CTC (continuous transaction control) mandates presents a formidable and ongoing challenge for multinationals. The landscape of regulations governing indirect tax and the application of tax technologies is expanding but often involves a lack of uniformity among different regulatory bodies. This complexity, fragmentation, and evolving nature of compliance requirements necessitates a dedicated and knowledgeable team.

  

We are seeking an Associate to join Pagero – Part of Thomson Reuters’ Regulatory Affairs (RA) team. The RA team has been instrumental in Pagero’s successful global expansion, establishing our position as the global leader in e-invoicing and CTC compliance. This role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to a dynamic and critical area of our business, ensuring that we continue to lead and innovate in this essential field.

 **About the Role**  

In this opportunity as Regulatory Associate, you will:

* Analyze and investigate requirements and legislation in markets that Pagero plans to enter
* Maintain and monitor up-to-date knowledge of regulatory requirements in markets that Pagero currently supports
* Create compliance related content, including blogs and updates, for internal and external readers
* Collaborate with stakeholders to launch new markets including integration, marketing, delivery, and more departments
* Present Pagero’s compliance solutions and relevant business cases to customers, curated for both technical and c-level audiences
* Address queries from internal and external stakeholders, ranging from simple to complex

**About You**  

You’re a fit for the role of Regulatory Associate if you have the following required qualifications:

* At least 1-3 years of experience in e-invoicing/CTC, tax technology and/or indirect tax.Applicants with legal or compliance experience in digital, privacy and/or security areas, and the readiness to apply that knowledge to digital settings, as well as to learn new skills, will be considered.
* Relevant academic degree: ex. Business, Law, Economics, or similar with relevant work experience
* Fluent in both spoken and written English
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment and document information clearly.
* Proficient with MS Office, comfortable with agentic AI and other planning and visualization tools
* Successfully pass an extended background check (criminal and credit).


Additional preferred qualifications include:

* Knowledge of other languages is highly merited, including French, German, Arabic, Mandarin and more (preferred, but not required)
* Experience in ERP, B2B and data integration including solutions such as managed services (preferred, but not required)


#LI-AB3

**What’s in it For You?**

* **Hybrid Work Model:** We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.
* **Flexibility & Work-Life Balance:** Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.
* **Career Development and Growth:** By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our Grow My Way programming and skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.
* **Industry Competitive Benefits:** We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
* **Culture:** Globally recognized, award-winning reputation for inclusion and belonging, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. We live by our values: Obsess over our Customers, Compete to Win, Challenge (Y)our Thinking, Act Fast / Learn Fast, and Stronger Together.
* **Social Impact:** Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.
* **Making a Real-World Impact:** We are one of the few companies globally that helps its customers pursue justice, truth, and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.
 **About Us**


Thomson Reuters informs the way forward by bringing together the trusted content and technology that people and organizations need to make the right decisions. We serve professionals across legal, tax, accounting, compliance, government, and media. Our products combine highly specialized software and insights to empower professionals with the data, intelligence, and solutions needed to make informed decisions, and to help institutions in their pursuit of justice, truth, and transparency. Reuters, part of Thomson Reuters, is a world leading provider of trusted journalism and news.


We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness, and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.


As a global business, we rely on the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of all employees to deliver on our business goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace.


We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law. More information on requesting an accommodation here.


Learn more on how to protect yourself from fraudulent job postings here.


More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

title: CRM-analytiker för välkänd hotellkedja
description:
### **Uppdraget**


Vill du arbeta med kunddata, kampanjanalys och lojalitetsinsikter hos ett välkänt nordiskt varumärke inom hotellnäringen? Då kan detta vara uppdraget för dig! Uppdragsgivaren bygger just nu ett strukturerat Customer Data Warehouse och söker en analytiker som kan bidra direkt från dag ett.

### **Om uppdragsgivaren**


Uppdragsgivaren är ett ledande nordiskt varumärke som satsar på datadriven kommunikation och kundinsikter. Organisationen är i en fas där CRM och lojalitetsarbete står i fokus, och där kunddata är en central del av den strategiska utvecklingen.

### **Om uppdraget**


Du kommer att förstärka teamet med fokus på att driva insiktsarbete kopplat till kampanjer, lojalitet och kunddata. Rollen kräver stark analytisk förmåga, god teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet av att arbeta nära marknads- och lojalitetsteam.

#### **Arbetsuppgifter innefattar:**

* Ad-hoc analyser och uppföljning av kampanjer och automationer
* Bygga och äga rapporter i Power BI/Tableau
* Definiera och följa upp CRM-relaterade KPI:er
* Segmentering, A/B-testning, retention/cohort-analyser
* Säkerställa datakvalitet och dokumentera antaganden
* QA av siffror inför release

### 

### **Krav och meriter**

* Erfarenhet av SQL (Snowflake-dialekt)
* Goda kunskaper i Power BI/Tableau, inklusive DAX och Power Query
* Erfarenhet av kampanj- och lojalitetsanalys (RFM, LTV, churn etc.)
* Förståelse för GDPR och dataskyddsfrågor
* Erfarenhet av SFMC (Salesforce Marketing Cloud) är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av kunddata inom hospitality/travel är starkt meriterande
* Självgående och van att hantera otydliga krav från stakeholders

### 

### **Placering och omfattning**


Uppdraget utgår från kontoret i Stockholm. Initialt önskas fysisk närvaro för onboarding, därefter finns möjlighet till distansarbete. Uppdraget är på heltid med omedelbar start. Initialt 3–6 månader med möjlighet till förlängning.

### **Vem är du?**


Du är analytisk, strukturerad och har ett öga för detaljer. Du trivs i en miljö där du får ta ansvar, arbeta självständigt och samtidigt samarbeta med olika delar av organisationen. Du har ett affärsdrivet mindset och är van att kommunicera med både tekniska och icke-tekniska stakeholders

#### **Ansökan**

  

För att kunna ansöka till Jappas uppdrag behöver du skapa en konsultprofil i vår plattform och sedan skicka in din ansökan. Genom att göra detta blir din kompetens även synlig för andra uppdragsgivare som letar efter e-handelskonsulter inför framtida uppdrag. Lägg ner 10-15 minuter på att skapa din konsultprofil idag för att vara i spel för spännande e-handelsprojekt!

 **Om Jappa**  

För e‑handelsföretag är det inte alltid lätt att hitta rätt kompetens när det behövs som mest. Men med Jappa blir det enkelt. Genom att använda vår plattform kan e‑handelsföretag söka bland ett brett utbud av kvalificerade e‑handelskonsulter och hitta den perfekta lösningen för sina behov, om det så är långsiktiga eller kortsiktiga uppdrag men också för rekrytering.

#### **Jappa är en talent-as-a-service-lösning för uppdrag inom e-handeln. Vi på Jappa strävar efter att erbjuda våra kunder konsulter som verkligen gör positiv skillnad i deras verksamheter.**

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**About us**

  

Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.

 **The Role**


We're looking for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer to join the Infra team at Soundtrack. The Infra team is at the heart of our platform and is responsible for scaling, modernising and maintaining the infrastructure that powers Soundtrack’s global music service.


Right now, the team consists of three senior members, with deep infrastructure backgrounds. To ensure we can keep scaling with our growing customer base, we’re strengthening the team with an additional team member who brings solid infrastructure knowledge and developer/automation skills.


You’ll be working closely with the Reliability team to improve monitoring and stability, and with our product development teams to ensure they can build on a robust, modern platform. Day to day, you’ll work with tools like Google Cloud, Kubernetes (GKE), Terraform, Helm and the Grafana stack to build, automate and evolve our infrastructure.

 **Responsibilities**

  

* Develop and maintain Soundtrack’s infrastructure in Google Cloud and Kubernetes (GKE)
* Improve and manage automation and infrastructure to ensure scalability, cost-efficiency and robustness
* Use Terraform to set up and manage projects and clusters
* Install and manage applications in Kubernetes clusters using Helm
* Operate and evolve the monitoring platform (Grafana stack: Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Tempo)
* Partner with development teams to understand and meet their platform needs
* Contribute to long-term architectural improvements and infrastructure modernisation.

  

**About You**


You're driven and


independent, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.

 **Requirements**

* 5+ years of hands-on experience with Kubernetes (preferably GKE).
* 5+ years of experience with Terraform.
* Solid experience with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud. AWS or Azure is also relevant, but you must be willing and able to quickly get up to speed with GCP.
* Ability to work independently in a small, senior team environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and eagerness to learn new tools and technologies.
  
* 

**Beneficial Requirements**

* Deep knowledge of Google Cloud.
* Expert knowledge of Terraform.
* Experience with Helm and the Grafana stack (Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Tempo).
* Programming experience in Go or Python (for internal tools and integrations).
* Previous experience working in a scale-up or tech company.
* Background in both infrastructure and development (hybrid skillset).
  

**Employee Benefits**

* + We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
	+ Generous pension plan
	+ Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
	+ Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
	+ Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
	+ Daily breakfast served at the office (if working from Stockholm)


At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.


We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.


Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: AWS Cloud Engineer
description:
🚀
 **Join Our Team VIPAS AB as an AWS Cloud Engineer** 
 🚀
   

  

 Do you want to be part of a journey where cloud technology powers innovation and digital transformation? At VIPAS AB, we believe the cloud is not just an infrastructure—it’s the backbone of future-ready solutions. As a growing IT & Engineering consulting company, we are looking for passionate
 **AWS Cloud Engineers** 
 like you to design, build, and scale next-generation cloud environments for our clients across industries.
   

  

**About VIPAS**
 At VIPAS AB, we go beyond traditional consulting. We deliver tailored solutions that bring real impact, using powerful technologies across
 **cloud, software development, embedded systems, automation, and DevOps** 
 . Our projects span across
 **automotive, telecom, retail, finance, and healthcare** 
 , offering consultants opportunities to work on diverse and impactful assignments.
   

  

 With every project, we combine deep technical expertise with a forward-thinking mindset, helping our clients achieve results that are both innovative and sustainable.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for skilled and motivated
 **AWS Cloud Engineers** 
 to join our growing team.
   

  

 In this role, you will design, implement, and optimize AWS-based solutions that ensure
 **scalability, security, performance, and cost efficiency** 
 . You will work on
 **infrastructure as code (IaC)** 
 , automation, cloud-native applications, and modern DevOps practices.
   

  

 Whether you’re a junior cloud engineer learning the ropes, a mid-level specialist building scalable platforms, or a senior architect shaping cloud strategy, you’ll find opportunities to grow and make an impact with us.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Cloud Architecture & Development**
* Design, build, and maintain cloud solutions on AWS (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, ECS, EKS, API Gateway, CloudFront, DynamoDB, Aurora).
* Implement serverless architectures and containerized workloads.
* Optimize systems for scalability, availability, and performance.


**Infrastructure as Code & Automation**
* Implement and manage IaC using Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, or CDK.
* Build CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, or AWS CodePipeline.
* Automate deployments, monitoring, and scaling.


**Operations & Monitoring**
* Configure and manage CloudWatch, AWS X-Ray, ELK/EFK, Prometheus, Grafana.
* Troubleshoot performance bottlenecks and optimize cloud costs.
* Ensure cloud systems meet high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) requirements.


**Security & Compliance**
* Implement IAM policies, KMS, Secrets Manager, WAF, GuardDuty, Security Hub.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards like ISO 27001, GDPR, PCI-DSS.
* Perform vulnerability assessments and cloud security audits.


**Collaboration & Innovation**
* Work closely with developers, DevOps, and business teams.
* Translate requirements into secure, scalable AWS architectures.
* Stay updated with the latest AWS services and best practices.


**Qualifications**
 We welcome applications from
 **all levels** 
 – junior, mid-level, and senior. Your responsibilities will be tailored to your experience.
   

  

**Core Skills (all levels):**
* Hands-on experience with AWS services (EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, IAM).
* Proficiency with Linux and shell scripting.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Git-based workflows.
* Understanding of cloud networking (VPC, Subnets, Route53, Load Balancers).


**Preferred Skills (role-dependent):**
* Experience with containers (Docker, Kubernetes, EKS, ECS).
* Knowledge of serverless (AWS Lambda, Step Functions, EventBridge).
* Familiarity with DevOps tools: Terraform, Ansible, Helm, Packer.
* Exposure to multi-cloud or hybrid environments (Azure, GCP, on-prem).
* Strong problem-solving, troubleshooting, and collaboration skills.


**Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Cloud Engineering, IT, or related fields.
* AWS certifications (Cloud Practitioner, Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer, Security Specialty, etc.) are a plus.


**Why Join Us?**
 At VIPAS AB, we believe in more than just filling positions—we believe in building futures. Our consultants choose us because we offer
 **security, transparency, and growth opportunities that last** 
 . As part of the
 **Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement** 
 , you can trust that your career is supported with fair compensation, solid benefits, and long-term stability.
   

  

 What sets us apart is the
 **diversity of projects** 
 . From
 **FinTech to Telecom, from Retail to Healthcare** 
 , our consultants gain real-world, hands-on experience across industries, strengthening their skills and broadening their horizons.
   

  

 Our culture is built on
 **collaboration, curiosity, and integrity** 
 . We celebrate innovation, embrace inclusion, and ensure that every voice is valued. At VIPAS AB, you don’t just join a company—you join a community that helps you grow both professionally and personally.
   

  

 📩 Interested? Apply today and take the next step in your
 **AWS Cloud career** 
 with VIPAS AB.
   

  

 👉 For more details, reach out to
 **pooja@vipas.se**
**Note:** 
 Applicants must hold a valid EU work permit. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—apply now before the opportunity closes.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig**
 För att du älskar att skapa system som är effektiva, kostnadseffektiva och använder en modern teknikstack. Du ser dig själv som en väsentlig del av teamet där din och teamets vision blir verklighet i molnet. Du vill göra skillnad genom att bidra med perspektiv, färdigheter och erfarenhet till olika branscher och miljöer.
   

  

 Som en del av vårt team kan din resa ta olika vägar när du utvecklar system tillsammans med våra kunder. Ibland arbetar du direkt hos kunden, men oftast sker arbetet internt – alltid med målet att leverera resultat av hög kvalitet. Du kan till exempel skapa en IoT-plattform, utveckla en applikation för sensorhantering inom MedTech, eller bygga en dataplattform för industriell produktion. Exakt vilket projekt du kommer att arbeta med vet vi först när du har blivit en del av Knightec, och det är just den variationen och möjligheten att själv välja projekt som gör arbetet här så spännande!
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software & Cloud, där vi hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem – från inbyggda system och elektronik till datadrivna företagsapplikationer, AI och molnbaserade lösningar.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Hjälpa våra kunder redan i ett tidigt skede genom att designa lösningsarkitekturer för molnbaserade system.
* Driva kunden i rätt riktning och bidra till att öka deras kompetens inom molntjänster.
* Arbeta både med lösningsarkitektur och hands-on implementering – du jobbar gärna i gränslandet mellan arkitektur och teknik.
* Stötta och vägleda våra kunder i strategiska frågor gällande arkitektur, kostnadsoptimering och innovation.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Expertis inom att skapa system från idé till färdig produkt, specifikt inom Azure eller AWS.
* Förmåga att tänka på kostnader och fördelar tillsammans med hållbarheten för systemet eller produkten.
* Starka kommunikationsfärdigheter både internt och externt gällande krav, behov och tekniska val.
* Flera års erfarenhet som mjukvaruutvecklare med en examen från teknisk högskola eller universitet.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.


**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**
 Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
   

  

 Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
   

  

 För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
   

  

 Låter det som platsen för dig? Häng med på en spännande resa!
   

  

**Praktisk information**
 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm, Rättarvägen 3 (Solna United). Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2025-10-18. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Albert Lindfors, Talent Acquisition Partner. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Channel Sales Manager Europe
description:
**The Company** 




 Sunway Communication is a world leader in the design and manufacturing of key components and modules for the consumer electronics, wireless IoT, automotive and telecom markets. Antennas, RF modules, wireless chargers, EMI/EMC shields, cables/connectors, passive components, electromechanical modules and other performance-critical solutions help our customers to gain competitive edge. Our components and modules are developed with, and supplied directly to, essentially all global top brands in the communication market. Our design offices are found in the US, Europe and across Asia supported by production locations in China, Vietnam and Mexico.
 



 Sunway already has a global footprint as a tier-one supplier to global leaders in its core markets, and now we are strengthening our focus on the European market. Sunway has a well-established global footprint and is headquartered and listed on the stock exchange in the high-tech center Shenzhen. Group revenues are around 1.2 BUSD.
 



 In Europe, we have an office in Sweden with dedicated professionals offering our RF, electromechanical and mechanical products to European customers as well as conducting research and development in collaboration with colleagues from our other research centers. Our Stockholm office features a fully equipped laboratory for RF and antenna testing including a 3D anechoic chamber as well as state of the art simulation and design software capabilities.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As Channel Sales Manager Europe your main responsibilities will be to develop both global and regional channel partners and drive sales through these channels. A major new product line for this sales channel is MLCCs (multilayer ceramic capacitors), where Sunway in 2023 officially inaugurated a greenfield factory with state-of-the-art manufacturing equipment to service the global market as a major future player. Other standard and customized products are expected to also play a big role in sales contribution. Our industry focus is the IoT, industrial, automotive and consumer electronics markets. You will report to the Vice President Europe, based in Stockholm.
 



  





**Your Profile** 




 We expect that you have solid experience of sales and development of channel sales and ideally product experience from passive components as well as our other relevant products. You are an ambitious and self-propelling individual with a network to help us develop the channel business substantially. We expect you to communicate fluently in English, and other major European business languages are a merit. You comfortably interface with colleagues in Europe, China, and the US since many projects are global in nature.
 



  





**What we Offer** 




 Although we are a large company, we have an entrepreneurial mindset instilled from the onset by our founder, who is still the largest owner. This is noticed particularly in our European organization, where we have a dynamic and fluid working environment. We have a high degree of freedom for own initatives and give you the ability to make a major difference to our company. Our decision paths are short, since we see our speed and flexibility as a major competitive edge. In Sunway, you have the opportunity to work with a wide spectrum of companies and technologies in a global environment.
 



  





 Your preferred office location will be Stockholm, Sweden, but home office in Europe can also be considered.

title: Solution Engineering Manager Cloud & AI Platforms
description:
Are you excited about leading teams to solve complex technical problems and drive AI transformation for customers? As a Solution Engineering Manager for Cloud & AI Platforms at Microsoft, you will lead a team of Solution Engineers in empowering our enterprise customers to achieve more through Microsoft’s cloud and AI technologies. In this role, you will model Microsoft’s leadership principles of Model, Coach, Care – fostering a culture where your team members grow, succeed, and feel included.
   

  

 As a manager of Solution Engineers, you will engage with key customer technical decision-makers, leveraging deep technical and industry knowledge to build credibility and ensure technical wins. The role includes orchestrating team resources, maximizing customer engagement impact, accelerating presales activities through deep technical expertise and thought leadership – as well as overseeing solution demonstrations, guiding customers through AI transformation and identifying new technical and business trends.
   

  

 Microsoft Sweden is expanding our Cloud & AI Solution Engineering team, which is at the forefront helping our amazing customers adopt and succeed in the age of AI.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Sales Discipline Enablement**
* Align with the Specialist Sales Manager on territory and account priorities across the Account Management Team and Customer Success Team, including opportunity management and forecasts
* Ensure the Solution Engineers in the team (covering Infrastructure, Applications, Data, and Software solutions) drive progress through key customer engagement milestones.
* Represent the Solution Engineering team in collaboration with business stakeholders to remove blockers and secure Azure wins across Infrastructure, Databases, Analytics, AI, and Applications.
* Coach and model best practices for the Solution Engineering Team to win customers through unified engagement strategies, skilling initiatives, and seamless transitions to the Customer Success Team and partners.


**Change Management**
* Lead the Solution Engineers within the team-based model to ensure clarity on the new approach and coordination with other sales functions
* Set team goals to win technical decisions to accelerate revenue and position Microsoft as the preferred platform
* Coach the team to regularly update progress milestones to accelerate deal velocity.
* Develop technical depth across Infrastructure, Data (including Microsoft Fabric), and AI-powered applications to support coaching and modelling of advanced solution capabilities.
* Build team expertise to Level 400 in solution knowledge and Level 300 in architecture across cloud migration, data platforms (Azure SQL, Fabric, Databricks), AI Foundry, application architecture, GitHub, and cloud-native development.


**Technical Sales Expertise Coaching**
* Ensure the Technical Sales Team leverages all available resources at Microsoft to advance customer engagement milestones.
* Mentor the team on technical whiteboarding and mapping business processes with customers.
* Collaborate with Global Black Belt Managers to escalate technical blockers to engineering teams for timely resolution.
* Build and maintain executive stakeholder support to remove internal and external barriers


**Qualifications**
* Extensive practical experience in designing and deploying enterprise grade systems in cloud, with strong knowledge of Microsoft Azure (or equivalent platforms) across multiple domains. Broad exposure and adaptability are valued over deep specialisation.
* Experience leading technical conversations with enterprise clients, from understanding requirements to presenting solutions and managing objections. Able to translate complex solutions into clear business value.
* Experience developing technical strategies aligned to business goals, including coordination with cross-functional teams such as sales, marketing, engineering and partners.
* Experience advising senior technical and executive stakeholders, with the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear, accessible way.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Proficiency in Swedish language
* Several years technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience
* Proven years experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management.
* A few years people management experience (including leading virtual teams).


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
