title: Cybersecurity Engineer
description:
### **Über die Aufgabe**

**Standort**
Schweden
Oestergoetlands laen
Finspang
**Remote oder Büro**Hybrid (Remote/Büro)
**Unternehmen**Siemens Energy AB
**Organisation**Gas Services
**Geschäftsbereich**Distributed
**Vollzeit / Teilzeit**Vollzeit
**Erfahrungsniveau**Berufserfahrene
  

**A Snapshot of Your Day**

  

Our customers are embarking on an exciting journey towards digitalization. They are experts in their core business, their market, and are well-equipped to handle their unique challenges. However, they sometimes face hurdles when it comes to digital development and remote operation. Fortunately, our Customer Technical Services (CTS) team is here to support them. By blending operation and enhancements of digital tools for remote diagnostics, along with a 24/7 help desk for three key products: Aeroderivative Gas Turbines, Medium Gas Turbines, and Small Gas Turbines customers, we aim to amplify reliability, availability, and efficiency. This is a thrilling chapter in our customers' stories, full of opportunities for growth and innovation.

  

As cybersecurity engineer you will be responsible to support the CTS organization with guidance and technical knowledge for cybersecurity topics. Within Customer Technical Support there is a need for someone with cybersecurity knowledge to work with our customers to ensure that the products and services align to their internal and Siemens Energy cybersecurity policies and certifications required. To drive continuous improvement within the organization and products to ensure we are providing a secure and sate of the art services and products.

  

**How You’ll Make an Impact**  



* Expert knowledge and support for the CTS organization as point of contact for cybersecurity topics.
* Acting as the interface for CTS to the larger cybersecurity community.
* Ownership of cybersecurity for CTS products and services.
* Project management of certifications required for CTS products and services.
* Conduct detailed risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies.
* Regularly assess project performance, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions.
* Working with customer projects to ensure secure deliveries to meet site requirements.

  

**What You Bring**

* Proven experience in cybersecurity.
* A Master’s degree or equivalent experience in a related field.
* Focus on the customer, working with our customers and adapt our solutions and processes to fit their needs
* Decisively move forward, move fast with simplicity, focus and ownership for decisions.
* Be open and inclusive, learn from others and leverage our differences to innovate for better solutions
* Build strong partnerships, care for others and deliver on our promises to win trust from our colleagues, customers & communities.
* Strong organizational and leadership skills.
* Excellent communication and negotiation abilities.
* Proficiency in project management tools and software.
* Ability to analyze information and provide reports and feedback to project team members and management.
* A good understanding of the Power Generation Services business in the Distributed Generation market, including but not limited to: customers, regional set-up, strategy, business processes, especially as these businesses/customers/markets/processes relate to digitalization.

  

**About the Team**

CTS provides a range of technical support services, including proactive, reactive, and consultative support along the entire train via a global Tier 1 / Tier 2 / Tier 3 setup. This setup features a 24/7 Operational Service Desk and Remote Diagnostic Centers, ensuring continuous support availability. Internally, the organization offers technical support for activities such as inspections, forced outages, and overhauls. Additionally, it establishes and maintains remote connections during both the New Unit Phase and the After Market phase, ensuring seamless operations.


Collaboration is a key aspect of the organization's operations bringing together MGT, AGT and SGT while working closely with CP & STG on common applications and aligns on a shared development roadmap. The GSO CTS team is responsible for maintaining CTS-related applications and tools, and they provide requirements to the Digital Development and Digital Sales teams.


Our **Gas Services division** offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.

  

We can offer you employment benefits such as: reduction of working hours, advance vacation, health care allowance and an eventual possibility to a flexible working place.

  

**Who is Siemens Energy?**


At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 98,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

  

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

  

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: **https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo**

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity**


Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

  

**Application**


Don’t hesitate – apply via **https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en\_US/jobs** or **https://siemensenergy.avature.net/internalcareers** , id nr 280895 not later than 2025-09-30

  

Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.


For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Robert Coffey on **robert.coffey@siemens-energy.com**


**For questions about** the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Johanna Sangrud on **johanna.sangrud@siemens-energy.com**


We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.

  

Location: Finspång

  

**Trade Union Representatives:**  

Anders Häll, Unionen, +46122-887514  

Simon Von Eckardstein, Sveriges Ingenjörer, +46122-842 24  

Jan Lundgren, Ledarna, +46122-812 33  

Mikael Malmgren, IF Metall, +4676-6958685

  

  

**#LI-MN1**

Job description
  
  

**Mission Description:**  

Do you want to work with advanced automation systems for modern surface vessels? Are you a driven automation engineer who thrives in a varied role covering electrical design, PLC programming, and system integration? If so, this could be the next step in your career!
  
  

**The Role:**  

We are looking for an Automation Engineer to join our growing team in Karlskrona. You will work with ship automation, monitoring, control systems, fire alarms, access and intrusion protection, as well as autonomous vessel projects. You will play a key role in developing the next generation of marine automation systems, working closely with both hardware design and software development.
  
  

**Your responsibilities will include:**  

Electrical design and PLC programming (Siemens, TIA Portal, WinCC)
  
  

Designing and integrating system solutions for vessel projects
  
  

Working with EPLAN, Aveva, and occasionally AutoCAD for schematics
  
  

Contributing to both new-build projects and upgrades of existing systems
  
  

Close collaboration with other engineering and design departments
  
  

Our projects range from large-scale new builds to continuous upgrades and adaptations of existing platforms. You’ll be part of a team that combines deep expertise with a strong collaborative spirit.
  
  

**Profile Requirement:**  

Who You Are
  
  

**We’re looking for someone who has:**  

5+ years of experience as an automation engineer or in a similar role
  
  

Solid knowledge of electrical design, system engineering, and PLC programming
  
  

Experience with TIA Portal, WinCC, Aveva, EPLAN
  
  

The ability to work independently, take initiative, and drive tasks forward
  
  

A strong interest in automation technology and a desire to grow in a broad role
  
  

Personality is just as important as technical skills. We believe you are proactive, curious, collaborative, and comfortable reaching out across departments to solve problems and move projects forward.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

Exciting projects within marine automation and autonomous vessels
  
  

The chance to work across the full lifecycle – from design to integrated system delivery
  
  

A skilled and supportive team with a mix of senior experts and younger engineers
  
  

A workplace with strong focus on innovation and development
  
  

On-site position in Karlskrona
  
  

**Details:**  

Permanent position
  
  

Full-time, daytime hours
  
  

**Start:** As soon as possible or by agreement
  
  

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this reason, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
company_description: Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. It gathers more than 7,500 people across 5 continents and more than 60 countries.

title: Cybersecurity Engineer
description:
**A Snapshot of Your Day**

  


Our customers are embarking on an exciting journey towards digitalization. They are experts in their core business, their market, and are well-equipped to handle their unique challenges. However, they sometimes face hurdles when it comes to digital development and remote operation. Fortunately, our Customer Technical Services (CTS) team is here to support them. By blending operation and enhancements of digital tools for remote diagnostics, along with a 24/7 help desk for three key products: Aeroderivative Gas Turbines, Medium Gas Turbines, and Small Gas Turbines customers, we aim to amplify reliability, availability, and efficiency. This is a thrilling chapter in our customers' stories, full of opportunities for growth and innovation.

  

As cybersecurity engineer you will be responsible to support the CTS organization with guidance and technical knowledge for cybersecurity topics. Within Customer Technical Support there is a need for someone with cybersecurity knowledge to work with our customers to ensure that the products and services align to their internal and Siemens Energy cybersecurity policies and certifications required. To drive continuous improvement within the organization and products to ensure we are providing a secure and sate of the art services and products.

  

**How You’ll Make an Impact**  



* Expert knowledge and support for the CTS organization as point of contact for cybersecurity topics.
* Acting as the interface for CTS to the larger cybersecurity community.
* Ownership of cybersecurity for CTS products and services.
* Project management of certifications required for CTS products and services.
* Conduct detailed risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies.
* Regularly assess project performance, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions.
* Working with customer projects to ensure secure deliveries to meet site requirements.

  

**What You Bring**

* Proven experience in cybersecurity.
* A Master’s degree or equivalent experience in a related field.
* Focus on the customer, working with our customers and adapt our solutions and processes to fit their needs
* Decisively move forward, move fast with simplicity, focus and ownership for decisions.
* Be open and inclusive, learn from others and leverage our differences to innovate for better solutions
* Build strong partnerships, care for others and deliver on our promises to win trust from our colleagues, customers & communities.
* Strong organizational and leadership skills.
* Excellent communication and negotiation abilities.
* Proficiency in project management tools and software.
* Ability to analyze information and provide reports and feedback to project team members and management.
* A good understanding of the Power Generation Services business in the Distributed Generation market, including but not limited to: customers, regional set-up, strategy, business processes, especially as these businesses/customers/markets/processes relate to digitalization.

  

**About the Team**

CTS provides a range of technical support services, including proactive, reactive, and consultative support along the entire train via a global Tier 1 / Tier 2 / Tier 3 setup. This setup features a 24/7 Operational Service Desk and Remote Diagnostic Centers, ensuring continuous support availability. Internally, the organization offers technical support for activities such as inspections, forced outages, and overhauls. Additionally, it establishes and maintains remote connections during both the New Unit Phase and the After Market phase, ensuring seamless operations.



Collaboration is a key aspect of the organization's operations bringing together MGT, AGT and SGT while working closely with CP & STG on common applications and aligns on a shared development roadmap. The GSO CTS team is responsible for maintaining CTS-related applications and tools, and they provide requirements to the Digital Development and Digital Sales teams.



Our **Gas Services division** offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.

  


We can offer you employment benefits such as: reduction of working hours, advance vacation, health care allowance and an eventual possibility to a flexible working place.

  


**Who is Siemens Energy?**



At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 98,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

  


Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

  


Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity**



Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

  

**Application**



Don’t hesitate – apply via https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en\_US/jobs or https://siemensenergy.avature.net/internalcareers , id nr 280895 not later than 2025-09-30

  


Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.



For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Robert Coffey on robert.coffey@siemens-energy.com



For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Johanna Sangrud on johanna.sangrud@siemens-energy.com



We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.

  


Location: Finspång

  

**Trade Union Representatives:**  

Anders Häll, Unionen, +46122-887514  

Simon Von Eckardstein, Sveriges Ingenjörer, +46122-842 24  

Jan Lundgren, Ledarna, +46122-812 33  

Mikael Malmgren, IF Metall, +4676-6958685

title: Operation Delivery Coordinator
description:
**Company Description**  

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We are working for fossil freedom, driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

 **Job Description**  

The Vattenfall Staff Function IT is an international unit within the Vattenfall Group. We are a full-service IT provider. Our IT services range from process and application consulting, to software development, implementation projects and the operation of IT applications. About 2000 employees located in Germany, Poland, the Netherlands and Sweden contribute daily to our international business success.

**Your job as Operation Delivery Coordinator**  

IT plays a crucial role within Vattenfall to enable our transition to fossil freedom and secure stable operations. Automation has an essential part in this journey. We rely on you, as our Operation Delivery Coordinator, to ensure that our automation platforms within Vattenfall are on top of the change and cater to the needs of our stakeholders!


The Operation Delivery Coordinator is a function that will help in interfacing between business needs , stakeholders and development by being able to identify automation needs , gather requirements from the business and the stakeholders, compose the technical documentation needed for the development team to be able to implement .

**Key Responsibilities :**

* Requirements Gathering: Engaging with stakeholders to collect and understand their needs, desires, and constraints related to the system or product.
* Requirements Analysis: Evaluating and refining the gathered requirements to ensure they are clear, complete, and feasible. This includes resolving conflicts between different stakeholders' needs.
* Requirements Documentation: Creating detailed and structured documentation, such as requirements specifications, user stories, and use cases, that clearly outline the expected functionality and constraints of the system.
* Requirements Management: Continuously tracking and managing requirements throughout the project lifecycle. This involves ensuring that any changes in requirements are properly evaluated and incorporated into the project, and that the development team adheres to the documented requirements.
* Stakeholder Communication: Acting as a bridge between the stakeholders and the development team. Ensures that all parties have a common understanding of the project’s goals and constraints.
* Verification and Validation: Assisting in the verification of the system against the requirements to ensure that the final product meets the agreed-upon specifications.

**Furthermore, you will:**

* Support in transformation/implementation of business needs/requirements into automation solutions
* Work with the engineers from network/storage/compute/applications etc. to develop & maintain the automations
* Work with the team when it comes to automation topics regarding best practices, defining frameworks, organizing workshops, etc
* Together with the development team plan and deliver workflows within the right process leveraging CI/CD, DevSecOps, Software Development Lifecycle and t other 3rd party systems to achieve it
* Develop, release and support automation code for our stakeholders

  

**Qualifications** **Who are we looking for?**


An experienced Automation Engineer meeting most of the following requirements:

* Academic degree or a comparable training with several years of experience
* Comfortable leading development teams
* Be proficient in identifying and collecting automation needs from the different teams involved
* Be able to clarify the high level process flow with stakeholders and motivate the use cases
* Have good project management skills and budget management skills
* Have good understanding of scrum and prioritization
* Have the capacity to gather details on the needed effort , create and propose a budget for the identified use cases
* Be proficient in preparing the identified cases for automation engineer to implement
* Knowledge & Exposure to Data Center Technologies & Automation
* Be self going with an ability to strive for the automation goals
* Business-fluent in English (oral and written)

  

**Additional Information** **Location**  

Solna. Some travel to other Vattenfall sites as well as international travel is required.

**For more information** about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager Catalin Popelca, catalin.popelca@vattenfall.com. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Amanda Pehrson, amanda.pehrson@vattenfall.com.


Trade Union representatives in Sweden: Akademikerna – Sofi Wadström, Ledarna – Christer Gustafsson, SEKO – Juha Siipilehto, Unionen – Patricia Ek. You can reach them on 08-739 50 00.

**We welcome your application** **no later than 25th of September 2025.** You apply easily through our career sight by submitting your CV and answering the screening questions. We do not accept applications through email.  

  

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.  

  

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.  

  

We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Measurement Solutions Field Application Engineer
description:
**Intro Text**
--------------

**Are you an experienced engineer with deep technical understanding of communication and data collection in the automotive industry? Do you want to work with the latest technology in measurement systems while being part of a global company with a strong local culture? Then you are welcome to apply for this position.**

  

As a **Measurement Solutions Engineer** at **Vector**, you will work closely with our customers in the Nordics and our international colleagues using the latest technology. You will be a technical expert in the measurement and analysis of embedded systems.


Our platform for advanced measurement and analysis is called **CANape**, which can also run on specially developed hardware. **VX1000** is our interface for embedded systems. See https://www.vector.com/canape

  

You will have the opportunity to influence the future of mobility in an industry currently undergoing a technological revolution. We are looking for someone who wants to help drive that development forward. Real-time measurement and analysis on Linux-based systems is one example. Travel is primarily within Sweden, but occasionally within the Nordics and to our headquarters in Germany.

 **Vector** is a global technology company with over 4,500 employees at more than 30 locations worldwide. We develop tools, software, and services to simplify the development of embedded systems. In Sweden, we have offices in Gothenburg (Lindholmen Science Park) and Linköping, where we combine the closeness of a small company with the resources of a large one.

**Your Tasks**
--------------

* Consulting on measurement solutions and data mining / advanced analysis for embedded systems in automotive (light and heavy vehicles)
* Assisting our customers as an expert with advanced troubleshooting, analysis, and data mining
* Collaborating with international teams and participating in global projects at Vector
* Contributing to technical presentations, seminars, and knowledge sharing
**Your Profile**
----------------

* Several years of industry experience, high service level, and self-drive with a “go the extra mile” attitude
* Programming experience, as we often assist our customers with customized scripts for our products
* Solid understanding of communication buses in automotive such as CAN, Ethernet, and XCP, among others
* Strong understanding of embedded systems and real-time systems from both a hardware and software perspective
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
**Techstack**
-------------

*C & C++*
company_description: Vector ist der kompetente Partner für die Entwicklung von Elektronik im Automobil – und das seit über 35 Jahren, mit mehr als 4.500 Mitarbeitenden an über 30 Standorten weltweit.

title: Commissioning Lead (HMP)
description:
**Job Overview:**

The Principal Commissioning Engineer interprets internal or external business issues and recommends best practices. They will be tasked with solving complex Commissioning-related problems and will work independently with minimal guidance. The Principal Commissioning Engineer may be responsible for leading functional teams or projects and is regarded as a specialist in Commissioning. As such, they must have in-depth expertise in Commissioning and broad knowledge of the Commissioning discipline within the Engineering function.


  
Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Reports to the Commissioning Manager and assist planning and execution of safe and efficient pre/commissioning activities, and for supporting the Client for the Start-up, and Performance Testing of the facility to achieve the production and performance objectives and contractual objectives.
* Leads the coordination and implementation of all commissioning requirements on the project.
* Responsible for the execution of the plant pre/commissioning activities in accordance with the Commissioning Execution Plan.
* Supervises the assigned pre-commissioning team personnel, subcontractors, and Client personnel in the execution of pre/commissioning activities in a safe, efficient, and successful manner.
* Oversee pre-commissioning activities for piping cleaning, mechanical equipment oil flushing, final alignments of rotating equipment, loading & final closure of stationary equipment within his area of responsibility, and repair and refurbishment of mechanical equipment during commissioning and operations as required.
* Manage commissioning activities for rotating machinery packages test runs and performance tests within his area of responsibility as required.
* Responsible for liaison with equipment manufacturers and suppliers for mechanical pre-commissioning, commissioning and repairs procedures for mechanical equipment / packages as required.
* Interface with the Sub-contractors on site for all Pre-commissioning activities
* Work with vendors and assist in Vendor Coordination for SAT’s and initial start-up as required.
* Develops work plans for execution of system pre/commissioning activities.
* Develops Safe Work Practice Procedures for all mechanical maintenance activities.
* Coordinate the issue of PTW and job safety analysis.
* Work collaboratively within the Project team and with Client to maintain positive relationships.
The project is in the Green Steel Market and the position is at Site in Boden, Sweden.  
* 

* Participates in the development of pre/commissioning plans, procedures & schedules.
* Participates in the development of spares, subcontracts, consumables, temporary equipment, and vendor services.
* Interfaces heavily with the completions team, construction, and Client personnel regarding all aspects of site inspections and testing for pre-commissioning, commissioning, and start-up activities.
* Participates in the Completion walkdowns, punch-list development and clearing of punch-list items by the Construction group or the subcontractor.
* Review and approve Subcontractors Method of Statement.
* Coordinate Subcontractors activities as per project schedule.
* Participate in SIMOPS meeting.
* Provides input to the “lesson learned” database.
* Provides input to the Close Out Report at the completion of the project.

Reports to:
  

Project: Project Commissioning Manager
  

Functional: Function Commissioning Manager
  

Liaise with: Discipline Lead Engineers, Project Engineers, Construction team, Quality, HSSE and Client designated representatives as required.
  

Supervises: Pre-Commissioning Specialists and support personnel within project team.


  
**Essential Qualifications and Education:**

* 10+ yrs in oil and gas with major contractor or consultant
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering
* Requires in-depth understanding of concepts, principles and practices in commissioning, completions, and training as well as basic knowledge of other functions, such as construction and operations & maintenance.
* Applies understanding of the industry to improve effectiveness.

**Preferred Qualifications and Education:**

* Preferably possess a degree or diploma or equivalent in engineering.
* Have a minimum of 10 years’ commissioning experience in the oil & gas, chemical process, or steel industry.
* Familiarization with the steel manufacturing process and equipment would be an advantage.
* Able to effectively communicate technical solutions and concepts to other engineers and non-engineers.
* Must have good computer software skills in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio.
* Must have good organizational skills and be adaptable to the needs of various discipline groups.
* Must have the ability to assess and communicate project requirements and expectations in a clearly defined, positive and productive manner.
* Proficiency in English, Multi-Language skills a plus.
* Valid Driver’s License for Site in Sweden.

**#LI-OO1**

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Location:** 

 Stockholm (In-person)
 




**Type:** 

 Full-time, early-stage hire
 




**Compensation:** 

 Competitive salary + equity
 




  





**About Dentio** 





 Did you know that 90% of all dentists spend time on administration after regular working hours? We are here to change that. We are Dentio, a Swedish tech company that lets AI handle dental administration. By recording patient appointments, our AI tool automatically generates records, dental charts and referrals. This allows dentists to focus on what really matters: their patients.
 




  






 After a successful soft launch, where around 50 dentists have started using the tool within a month, we are now moving into the next phase: a broader launch that will enable even more clinics to benefit from our technology.
 




  





**The Role** 





 We are looking for a Full Stack Engineer who thrives in early-stage environments, enjoys building from scratch and is excited to have real ownership. As one of our first technical hires, you will work directly with the founders to design, build and scale the Dentio platform. You will have the autonomy to make critical architectural decisions, influence product direction and grow into a future leadership role as we expand.
 




  





**Responsibilities** 



* Develop new features and services across the whole stack.
* Build integrations with external systems such as patient management systems.
* Work with CI/CD, operations, scalability and security.
* Take ownership of key technical decisions.
* Participate in architecture discussions, including design decisions to improve scalability.
* Write clean, testable code and perform code reviews.
* Contribute to shaping Dentio’s technical culture and ways of working.



  





**What We are Looking For** 



* 2–5 years of software development experience (full-stack or backend-focused).
* Strong knowledge of modern web technologies, ideally including React + TypeScript on the frontend and FastAPI on the backend.
* Experience with databases (SQL, ideally PostgreSQL) and cloud platforms (Google Cloud preferred, AWS or Azure also relevant).
* Familiarity with Supabase (or similar backend-as-a-service platforms like Firebase).
* Exposure to or strong interest in AI/ML-driven systems (LLMs, embeddings or data pipelines).
* Ability to own projects end-to-end — from architecture to deployment.
* Full professional proficiency in English.
* Eligible to work in Sweden.
* Bonus: Experience with healthcare SaaS or working in regulated industries.



  





**Why Join US?** 



* Achieve impact, your code and ideas will influence how dental practices operate worldwide.
* Competitive compensation + meaningful equity.
* Opportunity for quick career development as we grow and scale.
* Work in a mission-driven startup building tech that truly helps people.



  





**Apply Now!** 




 If you are excited about shaping the future of dental software and want to join a mission-driven startup at an early stage, we would love to hear from you.
 



  






 Send us your application including CV, LinkedIn and GitHub/portfolio along with a few lines about yourself to
 
 careers@dentio.io
 
 .
 




  





*Join Dentio and help us build the next generation of dental practice management.*

title: Embedded Engineer
description:
🚀
 **Join Our Team VIPAS AB as an Embedded Engineer** 
 🚀
   

  

 Do you want to be part of a journey where technology powers the future of mobility, automation, and connected devices? At VIPAS AB, we believe embedded systems are at the heart of innovation—from automotive and aerospace to consumer electronics and IoT. As a growing IT & Engineering consulting company, we are looking for passionate Embedded Engineers like you to help design and build tomorrow’s smart solutions.
   

  

**About VIPAS**
 At VIPAS AB, we go beyond traditional consulting. We deliver tailored solutions that bring real impact, using powerful technologies across software development, embedded systems, IoT, automation, mobile solutions, and project management. Our projects span across industries like
 **automotive, telecom, manufacturing, and healthcare** 
 , offering our consultants diverse challenges and opportunities.
   

  

 With every project, we combine deep technical expertise with a forward-thinking mindset, helping our clients achieve results that are both innovative and sustainable.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for skilled and motivated
 **Embedded Engineers** 
 to join our growing team.
   

  

 In this role, you will design, develop, and integrate embedded software and hardware solutions for real-world applications. You will work across the full lifecycle—from requirements and design to implementation, debugging, testing, and deployment—ensuring high performance, safety, and reliability.
   

  

 Whether you are just starting your career, building mid-level expertise, or driving senior-level strategy and architecture, you will find opportunities to learn, grow, and make an impact with us.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Embedded Software Development**
* Design, code, and test embedded applications in C, C++, or Python.
* Develop firmware for microcontrollers (ARM, PIC, STM32, AVR, TI, NXP, Infineon, Renesas, etc.).
* Implement and optimize software for RTOS (FreeRTOS, VxWorks, QNX, ThreadX, AUTOSAR) or bare-metal systems.
* Debug and troubleshoot low-level drivers, interrupts, and communication stacks.


**System Integration & Connectivity**
* Develop and integrate communication protocols: UART, SPI, I2C, CAN, LIN, Ethernet, USB, Modbus, BLE, Wi-Fi, Zigbee, LoRa, MQTT.
* Work with IoT platforms and edge devices, ensuring secure and efficient connectivity.
* Collaborate with hardware teams on board bring-up, schematics, and hardware-software integration.


**Testing & Quality**
* Write and execute unit tests, integration tests, and system validation.
* Use debugging tools such as JTAG, Oscilloscopes, Logic Analyzers, Lauterbach, GDB.
* Ensure compliance with MISRA C, ISO 26262, IEC 61508, or DO-178C (depending on domain).


**DevOps & Tools**
* Work with version control (Git), CI/CD, Jenkins, GitLab CI, Bitbucket pipelines.
* Experience with build systems (CMake, Make, Yocto, Buildroot).
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and virtualization for embedded development.


**Collaboration & Innovation**
* Translate requirements into embedded solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (hardware, software, systems, QA).
* Stay updated with the latest in embedded systems, tools, and industry standards.


**Qualifications**
 We welcome applications from all levels – junior, mid-level, and senior. Your responsibilities will be tailored to your experience.
   

  

**Core Skills (all levels):**
* Strong programming skills in C/C++ (Python or Rust is a plus).
* Experience with MCUs, SoCs, DSPs, or FPGA-based systems.
* Knowledge of embedded operating systems and real-time constraints.
* Familiarity with debugging tools and embedded testing methodologies.


**Preferred Skills (role-dependent):**
* Experience in Automotive (AUTOSAR, CAN, LIN, ISO 26262).
* IoT experience: MQTT, CoAP, AWS IoT, Azure IoT Hub, Google IoT Core.
* Exposure to Linux kernel, device drivers, or BSP development.
* Familiarity with MATLAB/Simulink for model-based design.
* Strong problem-solving, analytical thinking, and communication skills.


**Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Electronics, Electrical, Computer Science, Embedded Systems, or related fields.
* Master’s/PhD is a plus for senior/architecture roles.


**Why Join Us?**
 At VIPAS AB, we believe in more than just filling positions—we believe in building futures. Our consultants choose us because we offer
 **security, transparency, and growth opportunities that last** 
 . As part of the
 **Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement** 
 , you can trust that your career is supported with fair compensation, solid benefits, and long-term stability.
   

  

 What sets us apart is the
 **diversity of the projects we offer** 
 . From
 **automotive to telecom, from healthcare to consumer electronics** 
 , our consultants gain hands-on experience across industries, strengthening their skills and broadening their perspectives.
   

  

 Our culture is built on
 **collaboration, curiosity, and integrity** 
 . We celebrate innovation, embrace inclusion, and ensure that every voice is valued. At VIPAS AB, you don’t just join a company—you join a community that helps you grow both professionally and personally.
   

  

 📩 Interested? Apply today and take the next step in your
 **Embedded Systems career** 
 with VIPAS AB.
   

  

 👉 For more details, reach out to
 **shrini** 
**@vipas.se**
**Note:** 
 Applicants must hold a valid EU work permit. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—apply now before the opportunity closes.

title: Software Engineer - Java/AWS/DevOps
description:
**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 At Worldline, delivering a fantastic payment experience that our customers love is what drives us forward. Our cloud-native acquiring platform is processing billions of card transactions including authorization processing and clearing & settlement for our customers to trust. Currently, we are looking for a skilled product-oriented DevOps Software Engineer to team up with one of our product-oriented DevOps teams.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
 Our autonomous teams work with a lean product focused DevOps culture that continuously delivers true outcome, and if you build it, you run it! This means that you are responsible for:
   

  

* Active participation and contribution in all phases of the product lifecycle including discovery, delivery and operations
* Delivering your team’s committed objectives, adapting to whatever is needed to reach the goal you and your team have committed yourselves to reach
* Securing an outstanding qualitative service availability 24/7/365 and on-call duty is expected according to a rotating schedule


 You love identifying the outcomes to be achieved together with your team, our customers, our internal users, other stakeholders and suppliers to deliver a truly outstanding acquiring processing experience for our customer and our business to love.
   

  

**What Makes You Stand Out**
* You are a junior to mid-experienced Software Engineer used to full-cycle DevOps mode
* You have been developing in Java/AWS for some time exposed to micro-services and serverless technologies
* Have highly collaborative attitude, setting your team first while also successfully collaborating with others
* You are comfortable in a fast-moving and agile culture - handling many different stakeholders, prioritizations and fast decisions is not an issue for you
* If you have previous experience from the card-payment industry, preferably acquiring processing or other transaction intense industry where scale is important that’s a big advantage
* Being passionate about delivering a payment acquiring experience that brings value for our customers and our business
* Acting as a role model for your team and others by paying attention to commitment, accountability and the true outcome for yourself, your team, our customers and internal users


**Who Are We Looking For**
 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You also have:
   

  

* Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering or other meaningful field Have confirmed experience in software development including Java, Python and SQL etc.
* Experience from high-available micro-services and serverless architecture and design leveraging on the AWS cloud for scalability and resilience.
* As a result, we would like you also to have some experience in/interest for
* AWS cloud services including DynamoDB, Lambdas, S3 etc.
* Infrastructure as code using Terraform and CloudFormation
* Continuous delivery pipelines using Jenkins and GIT
* Docker
* Knowledge secure coding
* A deep understanding of software quality assurance principles
* Fluency in English (Swedish is an advantage)
* Valid working permit for Sweden (office location is Stockholm)


**Skills We’d Like**
* Experience from DevOps ways of working and lean culture
* Paying attention to commitment, accountability and result for yourself and for your team.
* Experience from developing secure and/or PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage
* Good communication and presentation abilities
* Challenging status quo
* Having a technical and curious mindset, continuously learning and sharing your knowledge with your peers and others.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2: nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we are looking for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

 Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com
   

  

 We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We in the Messaging team** 
 own everything under the messaging domain at Truecaller. We build, transform, and optimize existing and new features to make messaging more reliable and secure for our users. With over 450 million users, we operate one of the world's largest Instant Messaging (IM) services.
   

  

**As a Senior Backend Engineer in the Messaging team,** 
 you will collaborate with a dedicated team responsible for one of Truecaller's critical systems: the messaging platform. This includes the services to distribute: instant messages, business messages, and push messages.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Design and develop high-volume, low-latency services and cope with the challenge of working in a distributed environment.
* Operate mission-critical services at high availability.
* Collaborate across business units and drive solutions.
* Explore new solutions and technologies.
* Build a scalable and reliable system.


**What You Bring In**
* 4+ years of experience with Scala, Java, or Go
* Experience of working with scalable, highly available, real-time distributed systems
* Experience of working with non-relational databases
* Good understanding of data structures and algorithms
* Mentoring/ Leadership skills
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Experience building systems in the Google Cloud Platform
* Experience with virtualization environments, e.g., Docker
* Experience with systems for managing containerized applications, e.g., Kubernetes
* Experience with Cassandra and Kafka.


**Life At Truecaller - Behind The Code**
**https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget range.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Key Responsibilities
 



  





 • Lead the design and development of robust ETL workflows using Informatica/ PowerCenter/IICS/IDMC.
 



 • Architect and implement scalable data sourcing strategies from diverse systems (onprem, cloud, APIs). • Ensure data quality, lineage, and governance across ingestion pipelines.
 



 • Design logical and physical data models aligned with business domains and data product principles.
 



 • Contribute to the architecture of enterprise data lakes and data platforms.
 



 • Define standards for metadata, schema evolution, and data partitioning.
 



 • Build and optimize data pipelines on Azure Data Services (Data Factory, Synapse, ADLS).
 



 • Develop and manage Databricks notebooks and workflows for data transformation and analytics. • Integrate cloud-native tools for monitoring, logging, and performance tuning.
 



 • Implement CI/CD pipelines for data workflows using tools like Azure DevOps, Git, and Terraform. • Automate deployment and testing of ETL jobs and data pipelines.
 



 • Actively participate in SAFe Agile ceremonies, sprint planning, and backlog grooming.
 



 • Collaborate with Product Owners, Data Architects, and Business Analysts to deliver data solutions. • Contribute to the design and implementation of data products that serve analytical and operational needs.
 



 • Ensure alignment with enterprise data strategy and governance frameworks.
 



  





 Required Skills & Qualifications
 



 • 10+ years of experience in Data Engineering, with strong hands-on expertise in Informatica ETL.
 



 • Proven experience in data architecture, especially in data sourcing and data lake platforms.
 



 • Strong knowledge of Azure Data Services, Databricks, and cloud-native data engineering.
 



 • Exposure to DevOps practices and tools for data pipeline automation.
 



 • Experience working in SAFe Agile environments.
 



 • Solid understanding of data governance, metadata management, and data quality frameworks.
 



 • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
 



  





 Preferred Qualifications
 



  





 • Certifications in Azure, Informatica, or Databricks.
 



 • Experience with data mesh or data product architecture.
 



 • Familiarity with Python, SQL, and Spark
